definition: internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning

sentences.english: No peace, for they are lacking directions.
sentences.chinese: 不平安，因爲心中沒有方向，內憂外患。

sentences.english: During his life , Southern Song was threatened by both domestic trouble and foreign invasions.
sentences.chinese: 在他生活得年代，南宋一直處於內憂外患之中。

sentences.english: Against this background of internal turmoil and external threat lives a legendary queen.
sentences.chinese: 在此內憂外患之中，生活着一位傳奇的皇后。

sentences.english: BUT EVEN as a republic, China remained riven by internal strife and lacerated by external aggression.
sentences.chinese: 但即便在共和制度下，中國依然深受內憂外患的困擾。

definition: tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
turbulent situation/changing (face, scene, situation, world of etc)
Self-Strengthening Movement (period of reforms in China c 1861-1894), also named 自強運動|自强运动
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
